Does anyone know how much he charging per catalog? 
Thanks.
Ken
--- Jim Gilbert <jggilbert@...> wrote:
> David,
> The first has some introductory material for the
> auction series, the preface and introduction to
> Tsuba Geijutsu-ko and a glossary.  There are 239
> tsuba lots with a mix similar to what is in the
> other catalogs.  There are 40 lots of kodogu and
> some books, armor, etc.  There are about 68 lots of
> swords, including the Kokuho Iesuke, a Juyo Hasebe
> katana, a blade with Juyo tachi koshirae formerly
> owned by the Duke of Windsor, a daisho with gold
> mounted koshirae and another fancy daisho formerly
> owned by Admiral Nomura.  There's even a tanto by
> Francis Boyd.
> 
> Number 5 has more of Tsuba Geijutsu-ko including
> Haruta, Suruga, Kamakura bori and the various brass
> inlay types.  There are 248 lots of tsuba, again the
> usual mix.  Also 150 or so kodogu lots plus some
> books, armor and miscellaneous stuff.  There are
> inro, netsuke, ogime,etc., and 57 lots of prints.  A
> little bit of everything.  I vaguely recall
> something about many of the copies of number 5 being
> damaged in storage, but it may just be that fewer
> were printed.     
> 
> Alan Harvie has been selling new copies of the
> catalogs for years for a very low price, but he has
> run out of numbers 1, 5 and 10.
> Jim
> 
> 
> 
>   Can anyone tell me what's in vols. 1 & 5 of the
> Haynes catalogues, and why
>   it is the 5 is the least common?
> 
> 
> 
> [Non-text portions of this message have been
> removed]
> 
>
